text: Sunlight filters through the wooden window frames, spilling across the counter. The air still carries the fading warmth of last night’s hearth, so quiet it almost makes you forget time itself.
I’m counting the unpaid tabs from last night when a soft knock comes from the door.
“Good morning.”
It’s Alicia. She’s shed her armor, dressed instead in light brown travel clothes. The cracked sword still rests at her waist, as if it’s part of her body.
“It’s Sunday, right? The inn’s closed?”
I nod.
“Perfect.” She smiles faintly. “Come with me to the market. I need a few things.”
“Me?” I blink.
I hesitate, glancing out the window. The morning wind still carries a bite of cold, and the distant treeline is swallowed in mist.
“There’ve been monsters outside the town lately,” I say quietly. “A hunter mentioned it yesterday.”
“All the better,” she replies calmly. “If we run into one, someone ought to deal with it.”
The corner of her mouth lifts slightly—comforting, or perhaps simply stating a fact.
“What about Lucia? She’s not coming?”
“She was sorting herbs late into the night. She’s probably still asleep.”
After a pause, she adds softly, “Let her rest. She worked herself too hard.”
I sigh, take off my apron, and grab my coat.
East of town stretches a winding stone path, bordered by pine trees just thawing from winter. The air is damp, and somewhere in the distance, water rushes over rocks.
Alicia walks ahead with light steps, occasionally glancing back at me. Sunlight filters through the branches and spills across her shoulders.
“Do you always take this road?”
“Yeah. I don’t leave town much, but I know this path well. When the wine runs out, I still have to restock.”
“You really are alone most of the time.”
Her tone is casual, almost offhand. Yet her steps slow for just a heartbeat—as if listening to the wind.
The next moment, a low roar echoes through the trees.
The ground trembles violently, dead leaves swirling upward. A beast clad in rocky armor bursts from the earth, eerie green light burning in its eyes.
Before I can react, it lunges toward us—its presence thick with the scent of blood and iron.
